title: Batwoman's Ruby Rose licks The Flash star Grant Gustin's face on set
text:
Ruby Rose and Grant Gustin got up close and personal on set during a goofy moment together (Picture: FlightPhotoAgency)

Fans have finally been able to get a look at Ruby Rose in character as Batwoman now the show has kicked off in the States on The CW.

But the actress is already busy working on the upcoming Arrowverse crossover show, Crisis on Infinite Earths, set to air later this year.

While she’s working hard on the set in Vancouver, Canada, the Aussie star isn’t letting the long filming days wear her down as she was spotted having a playful moment with co-star Grant Gustin.

The pair were in costume as their characters Batwoman and The Flash when Ruby playfully pretended to lick her co-star’s face.

Grant – who has played The Flash since 2013, pulled a comical face as he donned his famous red and gold bodysuit.

The upcoming show will premiere on the The CW in December and also features popular heroes Supergirl, Arrow and Legends of Tomorrow.

Ruby clearly isn’t letting the long filming days wear her down (Picture: FlightPhotoAgency)

Former MTV Australia host Ruby is the newest member of the group now she stars as Kate Kane – Bruce Wayne’s cousin who shares his secret penchant for late hours of vigilante work.

Ruby recently shared a gruesome video of herself going under the knife in an attempt to explain to her Instagram followers how she acquired her new neck scar.

Crisis on Infinite Earth’s will be released on The CW this December (Picture: FlightPhotoAgency)

‘To everyone asking about my new Pez dispenser scar on my neck… a couple of months ago I was told I needed an emergency surgery or I was risking becoming paralyzed,’ she wrote.

‘I had herniated two discs doing stunts, and they were close to severing my spinal chord. I was in chronic pain and yet couldn’t feel my arms.

‘Thank you Dr Bray for everything you did and for allowing me to keep working and doing what I love.’

Crisis on Infinite Earth’s will be released on The CW this December.
